siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Structure and themes
frontmatter.description: Good structure supports many themes. Build the right structures to keep moving, building momentum, while rotating the themes.

frontmatter.title: Adaptable routines
frontmatter.description: Create routines that can be easily adapted to keep some level of normalcy and productivity.

frontmatter.title: Self sufficient habits
frontmatter.description: Tomorrow is back to school. Whether it's one or two kids, my attention must be with them.

frontmatter.title: Getting back on the saddle
frontmatter.description: autumn approaches. wheels are turning, gaining speed. back on the saddle

frontmatter.title: Stick to healthy habits at inflection points
frontmatter.description: Inflection points can be positive or negative. Stick to the good habits at times of change. Don't allow the changes to make it a negative inflection point. Develop a new positive trajectory.

frontmatter.title: Be diligent with healthy routines
frontmatter.description: Focus on consistency and quality will follow.

frontmatter.title: Develop habits with perpetual benefits
frontmatter.description: Great habits provide a continual chance for improvement.

frontmatter.title: Use aspirations to shape everyday habits
frontmatter.description: Use aspirations to shape everyday habits. Aspirations are less subject to change over time and should be used to guide specific, time-oriented goals. Set daily, small tasks to build towards the goal.

frontmatter.title: Build habits by creating streaks of small daily goals
frontmatter.description: Build habits by creating streaks of small daily goals. Start small and let the momentum and experience guide the progression.
